titleStmt.title: (Copy of) report to the archive concerning temple documents that have been sent

msContents.summary: The head of the priests notifies to the archive official (Zoilos) that the register of priests and administration concerning the year in question has been sent

msItem.note: 18 lines of cursive script along the fibres
Related to P. Fouad 186-189 (ed. A. Bataille, Un nouveau dieu Ä Bacchias, –tudes de papyrologie, 4, 1938, p. 197-205)

origin.origPlace: Bakchias, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

provenance.p: Purchased in Berlin by Lund University Library in 1933, from prof. Carl Schmidt; Isabella Andorlini "Scavi e acquisti di papiri negli anni '30: il caso dei PLund" in Comunicazioni, Firenze 1995, Istituto papirologico G. Vitelli, p. 45-50

div.ab: To Zoilos, official of the archive of the Arsinoite (nome), from Orsenouphis, son of Horos and presbyter of the priests of Soknobraisis, the great god of the village of Bakchias. I have handed in for registration, to you, a list of priests and inventories of the temple for the current year, which is the 7th year of the Imperatores Caesares Augusti, Lucius Septimius Severus Pius Pertinax Arabicus Adiabenicus Parthicus Maximus and Marcus Aurelius Antoninus.; (2nd hand:) I, Zoilos, official of the archive, have signed.

listBibl.bibl: P.Bacch. 12 SB VI 9332 P.Lund. III 1 BL III, 104; BL VIII, 343 (lines 8, 12, 18); X, 197; TM 14150; Wilcken, U., Archiv fír Papyrusforschung 13 (1939) p. 233; Hombert, M., Chronique d'–gypt 14, 1939, p. 400-401; Schmidt, K. F. W., Philologische Wochenschrift (Jahrgang) 60 (No 45/48), 1940, c. 608-611; van Groningen, B. A., Museum, Maandblad voor Philologie en Geschiedenis, 47, 1940, c. 168; N. E. G˜ran L˜vestan & Erik Swietlicki, Pixe analysis and imaging of papyrus documents, section IV. Proton-induced X-ray and gamma-ray emission, Nuclear instruments and methods in physics research B 45 1990, p. 307-310
